p: The number of calories that an average person needs on a daily basis is set based on the minimum (MDER) and average dietary energy requirements (ADER). However, specifically for this study, ADER was used since this indicator reflects the way in which FAO calculates the reference for adequate nutrition in the population. This value, according to FAO, was fixed for Peru at 2250 kcal per person and day in 2009 [ 40], a similar period of time to that of the diet patterns described above. However, as can be observed in Table 3, very few cities and other groupings that were analyzed reached this threshold only with the food that is purchased in the household. The reason for this lower registered value is linked to the amount of food that Peruvians consume as FAFH, which accounts on average for approximately 15% of the caloric intake [ 41], as explained below.
